summary: At first I kind of thought it was a kind of a clue to something else when Yeza said he needed to money to move to Diastock or...
body:
At first I kind of thought it was a kind of a clue to something else when Yeza said he needed to money to move to Diastock or Trostenwald, but well that’s overthinking it because duh.

Of course Yeza would want to move away from the town where his wife was abducted and murdered. And the home and business they literally built together. Staying there would suck.

summary: “Windowsill Talk”
title: “Windowsill Talk”
body:
i mean,, they talk about the nein so i think it counts

AO3

As soon as Yeza wakes up, he notices the cool absence of his wife next to him. He sits up, and puts his glasses on, nearly poking his eye out in the clumsy process. It takes a second for his eyes to adjust, but he sees Veth curled up in the windowsill. Her ears- and isn’t that new!

He’s not used to her ears telegraphing so much about her emotions, halfling ears aren’t nearly so versatile, it’s fascinating, really- but anyway. Her ears are drooping down, and she’s curled in on herself, arms wrapped around her knees. He scampers over, thankful for his natural light-footedness.

“Veth? Is everything alright?” he asks, keeping his voice low so he doesn’t startle her too badly. She doesn’t jump- just turns her head towards him with a melancholy smile.

“I’m- fine. It’s fine. Did I wake you up? Are you hungry? Do you need something?”

Yeza smiles at the familiar deflection- putting her own emotional worries aside to worry about someone else.

“I’m just fine, sweetheart. I conked out rather early.”

He pulls himself up next to her on the windowsill. They sit in silence together, watching the moon outside the window, minutes passing before Yeza speaks again.

“So, tell me more about your new friends? They’re very,” tall, weird, frightening, competent, “eclectic.”

She smiles, a familiar expression, although the fangs are certainly a new and exciting addition. He can hear the love in her voice as she describes them to him.

“Oh they’re, they’re something alright. A bunch of weirdos, but- but they’re my weirdos now. There’s Caleb, of course, I met him long before I met the others, right after the- ah, the goblins, in prison. We broke out of prison together, actually! His cat brought me a wire and I picked the lock and we set it on fire!

He’s, he’s very smart, as smart as you, certainly, and he knows so much magic! He’s been teaching me, you know, all sorts of little spells, like mage hand and such,” at this, she says some odd words and moves her hands in a funny sort of way and disappears!

Yeza yelps a little in surprise, but when he reaches forward, he can feel the rough-spun cloth of her cloak. “Whoa!” he exclaims, eyes wide with wonder. “Honey, this is- this is amazing! I’ve never even- you can turn invisible!”

She reappears, her cheeks a darker green than the surrounding skin in what he supposes is a blush. He takes one of her hands in his. He can see she’s uncomfortable with the praise, and supposes he’s got plenty of time to tell her how much he loves her later.

“So, about your other companions?” he says.

Again, her face lights up, and Yeza thinks maybe he’ll have to thank these people, these colorful strangers, because they’ve made his wife happy when he couldn’t.

“Well, there’s also Jester, we’re best friends, and detectives together, although we’re discussing possibly letting Beau join, that’s still in the air- anyway, she’s a healer, but she likes hitting things much more than healing, and she’s very good at it too! The hitting thing, I mean, but she’s also very heal-ey!

Beau, she’s the monk with a scary looking face, and she is very scary, but she’s also kind of nice? and yells at strangers who are rude to the group, and she’s getting better at talking to people- or at least that’s what she and Fjord say, I haven’t actually seen it happen yet, but I suppose I’ll trust them. And then there’s Fjord…”

They stay huddled in the window until sunrise, Yeza listening to Veth’s commentary on her companions. There were a fair amount of jokes he didn’t understand- something about the gnolls, and- the number nine? But, he has time to learn, now. He has his wife back, and that is- more than he’d even dreamed of, and now he has all sorts of time to learn about her adventures.

i mean,, they talk about the nein so i think it counts

summary: Have a messy Jester for episode 3 of Pub Draw. I peeped at Ari's official artwork for some of Jester's details, and I really...
body: Have a messy Jester for episode 3 of Pub Draw. I peeped at Ari’s official artwork for some of Jester’s details, and I really tried to experiment with flair for this one. The hair and horns are wonky as hell but I’m still very happy with my progress.

reblog.comment: Have a messy Jester for episode 3 of Pub Draw. I peeped at Ari’s official artwork for some of Jester’s details, and I really tried to experiment with flair for this one. The hair and horns are wonky as hell but I’m still very happy with my progress.

summary: this calamity, this garden once was perfect - Chapter 1 - partingxshot - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
title: this calamity, this garden once was perfect - Chapter 1 - partingxshot - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Fandom: Critical Role
Relationships: Clayleb (Caduceus/Caleb)
Additional Info: I posted a snippet of this the other day; here’s the full first chapter. (In which Caleb experiences what you might call “culture shock” while learning the basics of Caduceus’s ethical system.)

AO3 Summary:  Caduceus’s eyes are silvered in the gloom, like an old and beautiful creature watching him from the darkness of the treeline.

“Somebody has to spare them,” he says.

summary: hello i have two (2) interests right now, and im just saying, if anyone in the nein were to figure skate it’d be beau and jester...
caption:
hello i have two (2) interests right now, and im just saying, if anyone in the nein were to figure skate it’d be beau and jester and they’d be AMAZING

costumes inspired by kristi yamaguchi’s 1992 original program for jester (i love this outfit So Much Holy Shit??), and even more vaguely shoma uno’s 2015 free skate outfit for beau, obvs sans sleeves, and added sash and honestly at this point it barely looks like it but that’s where i got the inspiration from originally, in case anyone were wondering. 

also pose ref: [x]

blog.name: nilim
blog.title: The sky may be falling, but the stars look good on you
blog.description:
D&D, Critical Role, Discworld. 
-
I create meta, gifsets, fanart and fanfiction.

My inbox is always open for prompts, and I love getting them... but no guarantees.

summary: I’m pretty sure Matt used a bunch of Hearthstone music in the last episode, and I wonder if that made me question NPC...
body: I’m pretty sure Matt used a bunch of Hearthstone music in the last episode, and I wonder if that made me question NPC motivations more than usual, because that music has conditioned me to concentrate and strategize like nobody’s business.

reblog.comment: I’m pretty sure Matt used a bunch of Hearthstone music in the last episode, and I wonder if that made me question NPC motivations more than usual, because that music has conditioned me to concentrate and strategize like nobody’s business.

blog.name: pagerunner-j
blog.title: Page's Page
blog.description: fandom, fun things, and other nonsense

tags: behold: a veritable army of cuddly little bears
may sam be haunted by them all in his sleep
summary: I was feeling silly and decided to tally up how many KS backers so far have pledged at the Fighter level or above. Why? Because...
body:
I was feeling silly and decided to tally up how many KS backers so far have pledged at the Fighter level or above. Why? Because these are the tiers that include the Trinket plushie.

Current tally: 14,056.

That is a _lot of bears_, people.

reblog.comment:
